meanings.definition: To make or become round or full in shape
meanings.sent1: She plumps the pillows on the couch before guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: The baker plumps the dough to create fluffy bread.
meanings.sent3: The balloon plumps up as air is blown into it.
meanings.sent4: The flowers plump out after a good rain, looking more vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The chef plumps the pasta by adding extra sauce for flavor.

meanings.definition: A sound made by something falling heavily
meanings.sent1: The plumps of the heavy book hitting the table echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: The plumps of raindrops on the roof signaled the start of a storm.
meanings.sent3: The plumps of the ripe fruit falling from the tree delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The plumps of the hammer hitting the nail filled the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The plumps of the basketball hitting the court were heard across the gym.

meanings.definition: A group of birds or animals gathered closely together
meanings.sent1: A plumps of ducks waddled by the pond in search of food.
meanings.sent2: The plumps of penguins huddled together to stay warm in the cold.
meanings.sent3: The plumps of sheep in the field created a peaceful scene.
meanings.sent4: The plumps of fish swimming in the aquarium captivated the visitors.
meanings.sent5: A plumps of geese flew overhead, honking loudly as they passed.
